cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles east of Tampico Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northeast later today, accelerate toward the Florida Panhandle/northern Gulf Coast, then sweep northeastward across GA–SC–NC and move offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Panhandle (between the Mississippi/Alabama border and the Ochlockonee River, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch is posted east of the Ochlockonee River to Yankeetown, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning from Grand Isle, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River and from the MS/AL border to the Ochlockonee River, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA to FL Big Bend) and, later, the Atlantic coast from GA through the Carolinas to the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty winds Sunday night into Monday, generally below tropical-storm force (25–35 mph gusts)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the New Jersey coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Sunday–Monday as the remnants pass offshore, producing brief heavy downpours
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor tidal flooding or reduced visibility in heavy rain could briefly disrupt vessel movements and cargo operations
